title: How is the Rochester Institute of Technology Computer Science Programs? - Quora

response.answer_text: R.I.T. Has one of the very best Job Placement rates after graduating. They are mostly known for G.C.C.I.S., which is the Gollisono College of Computing and Information Sciences. When I graduated I already had a full-time offer for the company I had started working for my senior year. The best thing about RIT is the co-op program. I didn’t realize how much I really learned at RIT until after I tried to hire an intern at my company. Other colleges seem to focus more on parties or just getting you ready to live by yourself, but at RIT I learned fundamentals that are required for my every day job. Most of this I learned outside of the classroom, because the people that make it into RIT are among the most brilliant and dedicated you’ll find. Get yourself into a Special Interest House like CSH and you’ll learn more than you will the rest of your life. Another fun little story, right after I was accepted to RIT my dad was bragging to someone from his work about me getting in. Someone overheard him and pulled him aside and gave him his card and told him to have me give him a call after my first year when I needed a co-op (paid internship). He worked for Lockeed Martin and had a few RIT grads that were his smartest employees. You’ll find lots of those “oh you’re graduating with an SE/CS degree from RIT? When can you start?” RIT isn’t better at everything, the math and lit classes are less than perfect, but for the high-tech stuff it’s the best in the business. It’s well worth attending but only if you dedicate yourself to learning. The weather is crappy and the social life is hard to find, leading to a pretty high drop-out rate, but if you can make it the real world is a breeze afterwards.

Hi, the Computer Science programs offered by the Rochester Institute of Technology are flexible to students with affordable tuition. You can also take these programs online. RIT offers 40 online programs across 11 disciplines in undergraduate and graduate degrees. Some of the Computer Science programs offered online are MS in Computing Security, MS in Data Science etc. The average tuition for Masters degree is $1136 per credit. To know more about RIT’s onine programs and tuition, visit Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT) Rochester, New York Online Programs, Degrees and Tuition Details
